snippet: The infection spread among gay and bisexual men in New York City who met at parties, bars, clubs and through Web sites and hookup apps.
abstract: Bacterial meningitis outbreak among gay and bisexual men in New York City that had raised fears of a new AIDS-type epidemic has subsided after an aggressive vaccination campaign; city health officials remain cautiously optimistic that it has been contained.
lead_paragraph: The infection spread among gay and bisexual men in New York City who met at parties, bars, clubs and through Web sites and hookup apps.

headline.main: Vaccination Appears to Have Halted a Meningitis Outbreak
headline.print_headline: Vaccination Appears to Have Halted a Meningitis Outbreak
